timeline.bodyText: Calling platformMXBean.getHeapMemoryUsage() returns a snapshot of the current usage. Calling java.lang.management.MemoryUsage#getUsed, for example, on the same instance will always return the same value.
timeline.author: felixbarny

timeline.bodyText:
What's the rationale behind splitting by eden/survivor/tenured?
It also looks like this adds multiple heap metrics with the same name and same labels which will override the previous metric. Did you mean to accumulate the values of all survivor spaces, for example? Or would they be reported separately but with different labels for the name?
timeline.author: felixbarny

replies.bodyText:
I think it will be more informative. And this detailed information can help to add specific alerts.
Yes, I mean that they will be reported separately but with different lables(I fixed it with last commit)
replies.author: kananindzya

timeline.author: eyalkoren

replies.bodyText: It's changed after running tests, I think. Now in the master branch the value is already "1.30.0"
replies.author: kananindzya

timeline.bodyText: As these metrics nice-to-have, please surround with try/catch, and either log error on failure or debug on success. It will help us test that we don't break anything on all JVMs we use in the integration tests (including J9)
timeline.author: eyalkoren
